titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1477: Istruzioni a voi Signor Pietro d'Agostino della relazione che s'aver à Sua Maestà delle cose di Sicilia ... etc.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title of predominant work (f. 63r).
For records for the individual works in this volume, do a title search for UPenn Ms. Codex 1477.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of two bound works concerning the kingdom of Sicily, with the first, Tratato curioso del regno di Sicilia, written in the first quarter of the 17th century by an anonymous author, and the second, Istruzioni a voi Signor Pietro d'Agostino, written in the second half of the 16th century by Ferrante Gonzaga, prince of Molfetta.

msItem.title: Istruzioni a voi Signor Pietro d'Agostino della relazione che s'aver à Sua Maestà delle cose di Sicilia ... etc.
Table of contents, f. iii recto
Tratato curioso del Regno di Sicilia, f. 1r
Istruzioni a voi Signor Pietro d'Agostino della relazione che s'aver a? Sua Maesta? delle cose di Sicilia, f. 62r

supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (later paper) + 65 + 23 + i (later paper); [iv], 1-60, [61-84]; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto, modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in cursive script by multiple hands.

binding.p: Half calf (Zacour-Hirsch), Discorso sopra la Sicilia and gilt on spine; edges sprinkled in red.

origin.p: Written in Italy, one work in 1546 (f. 84v), the other between 1600 and 1625 (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Formerly in the collection of Sir Thomas Phillipps, ms. 2826, with older signature, no. 11314/76 (stamp on f. [i] recto).
